pullsbody:
Fixes #225


As of January 1 2019, Mozilla requires that all GitHub projects include this [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file in the project root. The file has two parts:

1. Required Text - All text under the headings *Community Participation Guidelines and How to Report*, are required, and should not be altered.
2. Optional Text - The Project Specific Etiquette heading provides a space to speak more specifically about ways people can work effectively and inclusively together. Some examples of those can be found on the [Firefox Debugger](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) project, and [Common Voice](https://github.com/mozilla/voice-web/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). (The optional part is commented out in the [raw template file](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md), and will not be visible until you modify and uncomment that part.)

If you have any questions about this file, or Code of Conduct policies and procedures, please see [Mozilla-GitHub-Standards](https://wiki.mozilla.org/GitHub/Repository_Requirements) or email Mozilla-GitHub-Standards+CoC@mozilla.com.

_(Message COC002)_
pull_repo_desc: Mozilla's new typeface, used in Firefox OS
pull_commit_message:
Add Mozilla Code of Conduct file

Fixes #225.

_(Message COC002)_

pulltitle: Add more information to bower.json and ignore files
pullsbody:
- Adds some more information to the bower package
- Ignores files which are not needed for the bower package
As requested here: https://github.com/mozilla/Fira/pull/52#issuecomment-67426238
I think we don't need `source` and `technical reports` in the bower
package. It's very annoying to download all the PDFs and sources every
time...
pull_repo_desc: Mozilla's new typeface, used in Firefox OS
pull_commit_message:
Add more information to bower.json and ignore files

As requested here:
https://github.com/mozilla/Fira/pull/52#issuecomment-67426238
I think we don't need `source` and `technical reports` in the bower
package. It's very annoying to download all the PDFs and sources every
time...

pulltitle: fira-sans.*: local font “Fira Sans Regular *” → “Fira Sans *”
pullsbody:
At least under Linux (Ubuntu), the regular and regular italic system fonts are recognized as “Fira Sans” and “Fira Sans Italic”, while the stylesheets for CSS pre-processors call them as “Fira Sans Regular” and “Fira Sans Regular Italic”, respectively.

This commit fixes the names by removing the “Regular” part.

Note that I do not know how fonts are treated on other systems (it might be worth checking that this commit does not breaks things under Windows?)
pull_repo_desc: Mozilla's new typeface, used in Firefox OS
pull_commit_message:
fira-sans.*: local font “Fira Sans Regular *” → “Fira Sans *”

At least under Linux (Ubuntu), the regular and regular italic system
fonts are recognized as “Fira Sans” and “Fira Sans Italic”, while the
stylesheets for CSS pre-processors call them as “Fira Sans Regular” and
“Fira Sans Regular Italic”, respectively.

This commit fixes the names by removing the “Regular” part.

Note that I do not know how fonts are treated on other systems (it might
be worth checking that this commit does not breaks things under
Windows?)

pullsbody:
Since commit 317e6c0d9a06c9b9db2a7b1281ccb7e8f983cd98 (and then d6d05bf47955a36aab5d66319882b17b95944d92), the fonts “FiraSans-RegularItalic” have disappeared since they were the same files as the “FiraSans-Italic” series. But it seems that the files from CSS frameworks (Less, Sass, Scss and Styl) have not been updated.

This commit updates the names so that inclusion of the files for regular italic flavor of the fonts works properly.
pull_repo_desc: Mozilla's new typeface, used in Firefox OS
pull_commit_message:
fira-sans.*: Rename “FiraSans-RegularItalic” to “FiraSans-Italic”

Since commit 317e6c0d9a06c9b9db2a7b1281ccb7e8f983cd98 (and then
d6d05bf47955a36aab5d66319882b17b95944d92), the fonts
“FiraSans-RegularItalic” have disappeared since they were the same files
as the “FiraSans-Italic” series. But it seems that the files from CSS frameworks
(Less, Sass, Scss and Styl) have not been updated.

This commit updates the names so that inclusion of the files for regular
italic flavor of the fonts works properly.

pull_commit_message:
Encourage HTTPS

Encourage HTTPS as protocol-relative URL is deprecated.
See <http://www.paulirish.com/2010/the-protocol-relative-url/>.

> Now that SSL is encouraged for everyone and doesn’t have performance concerns, this technique is now an anti-pattern. If the asset you need is available on SSL, then always use the https:// asset.

pulltitle: Restore line spacing from version 2.001 in OTF fonts.
pullsbody:
Using TTX, I've modified all three vertical metric fields to have a consistent ascent of 935 and descent of 265, to match what was defined in the previous release of the fonts. (See comments on issue #33 for discussion/explanation.) This should ensure consistent line spacing across Windows, Mac OS and Linux.

TODO: The other formats (TTF, EOT, WOFF) still need to be regenerated based on these.
pull_repo_desc: Mozilla's new typeface, used in Firefox OS
pull_commit_message:
Restore line spacing from version 2.001 in OTF fonts.

Using TTX, I've modified all three vertical metric fields to have a
consistent ascent of 935 and descent of 265, as in the previous release
of the fonts.

TODO: The other formats still need to be regenerated based on these.
